item.title: MJ add a quote by Janet Evanovich
item.description: "Exercise improves your sex life. Ranger to Stephanie" -- Janet Evanovich

item.title: MJ add a quote by Jane Austen
item.description: "The more I know of the world, the more I am convinced that I shall never see a man whom I can really love. I require so much!" -- Jane Austen

item.title: MJ add a quote by Mark Twain
item.description: "The man who does not read has no advantage over the man who cannot read." -- Mark Twain

item.title: MJ add a quote by Nick Hornby
item.description: "People worry about kids playing with guns, and teenagers watching violent videos; we are scared that some sort of culture of violence will take them over. Nobody worries about kids listening to thousands - literally thousands - of songs about broken hearts and rejection and pain and misery and loss." -- Nick Hornby

item.title: MJ add a quote by Terry Pratchett
item.description: "Some humans would do anything to see if it was possible to do it. If you put a large switch in some cave somewhere, with a sign on it saying 'End-of-the-World Switch. PLEASE DO NOT TOUCH', the paint wouldn't even have time to dry." -- Terry Pratchett

item.title: MJ add a quote by Alan Alda
item.description: "Begin challenging your own assumptions. Your assumptions are your windows on the world. Scrub them off every once in awhile, or the light won't come in." -- Alan Alda

item.title: MJ add a quote by Virginia Woolf
item.description: "For most of history, Anonymous was a woman." -- Virginia Woolf

item.title: MJ add a quote by Anatole France
item.description: "Never lend books, for no one ever returns them; the only books I have in my library are books that other folks have lent me." -- Anatole France

item.title: MJ add a quote by Soren Kierkegaard
item.description: "The function of prayer is not to influence God, but rather to change the nature of the one who prays." -- Soren Kierkegaard

item.title: MJ add a quote by Jasper Fforde
item.description: "Take no heed of her.... She reads a lot of books." -- Jasper Fforde

item.title: MJ add a quote by Sue Grafton
item.description: "Thinking is hard work, which is why you don't see many people doing it." -- Sue Grafton

item.title: MJ add a quote by Friedrich Nietzsche
item.description: "It is hard enough to remember my opinions, without also remembering my reasons for them!" -- Friedrich Nietzsche

item.title: MJ add a quote by Elie Wiesel
item.description: "There may be times when we are powerless to prevent injustice, but there must never be a time when we fail to protest." -- Elie Wiesel

item.title: MJ add a quote by Janet Evanovich
item.description: "My professional aspirations were simple - I wanted to be an intergalactic princess." -- Janet Evanovich

item.title: MJ add a quote by Diana Gabaldon
item.description: "When the day shall come that we do part," he said softly, and turned to look at me, "if my last words are not 'I love you'-ye'll ken it was because I didna have time." -- Diana Gabaldon

item.title: MJ add a quote by Catherine Aird
item.description: "If you can't be a good example, then you'll just have to be a horrible warning." -- Catherine Aird

item.title: MJ add a quote by Katharine Hepburn
item.description: "Sometimes I wonder if men and women really suit each other. Perhaps they should live next door and just visit now and then." -- Katharine Hepburn

item.title: MJ add a quote by Winston S. Churchill
item.description: "Success is not final, failure is not fatal: it is the courage to continue that counts." -- Winston S. Churchill

item.title: MJ add a quote by Alan Alda
item.description: "No man or woman of the humblest sort can really be strong, gentle and good, without the world being better for it, without somebody being helped and comforted by the very existence of that goodness." -- Alan Alda

item.title: MJ add a quote by Emily Dickinson
item.description: "Beauty is not caused. It is." -- Emily Dickinson

item.title: MJ add a quote by George Harrison
item.description: "It's being here now that's important. There's no past and there's no future. Time is a very misleading thing. All there is ever, is the now. We can gain experience from the past, but we can't relive it; and we can hope for the future, but we don't know if there is one." -- George Harrison

item.title: MJ add a quote by Elie Wiesel
item.description: "We must always take sides. Neutrality helps the oppressor, never the victim. Silence encourages the tormentor, never the tormented." -- Elie Wiesel

item.title: MJ add a quote by T.S. Eliot
item.description: "Only those who will risk going too far can possibly find out how far one can go." -- T.S. Eliot

item.title: MJ add a quote by Dr. Seuss
item.description: "The more that you read, the more things you will know. The more that you learn, the more places you'll go." -- Dr. Seuss

item.title: MJ add a quote by Barack Obama
item.description: "There's not a liberal America and a conservative America - there's the United States of America." -- Barack Obama

item.title: MJ add a quote by William Shakespeare
item.description: "Let me be that I am and seek not to alter me." -- William Shakespeare

item.title: MJ add a quote by Ralph Waldo Emerson
item.description: "Some books leave us free and some books make us free." -- Ralph Waldo Emerson

item.title: MJ add a quote by Lewis Carroll
item.description: "The time has come," the walrus said, "to talk of many things: Of shoes and ships - and sealing wax - of cabbages and kings" -- Lewis Carroll

item.title: MJ add a quote by Meg Cabot
item.description: "So Uncle Stuart is marrying that lady? Mom says she's going to be our aunt Amy. She's okay except she would't try any peanut butter M&M chocolate chip fudge cookies. They were good- you ate five, remember? But she said she was on a special diet, and couldn't eat something called carbs. We told her we didn't put any carbs in our cookies, just M&Ms, but she said M&Ms were carbs. Uncle Mitch, what's carbs? email to Uncle Mitch from Haily and Brittany" -- Meg Cabot

item.title: MJ add a quote by Margaret Fuller
item.description: "Today a reader, tomorrow a leader." -- Margaret Fuller
